meta.name: Real-time PulsePoint Emergency Alerts to iMessage with AI Summaries

parameters.content:
## Using the n8n HTTP Request Node to Send a Blooio.com Message

Follow these steps to configure your existing HTTP Request node in n8n so you can send SMS or email via the Blooio.com API.

---

### 1. Open Your HTTP Request Node

- In your workflow, click on the HTTP Request node youâ€™ve already added (e.g. **Send Message**).

---

### 2. Set Up the Request

| Field                 | Value                                              |
|-----------------------|----------------------------------------------------|
| **Request Method**    | `POST`                                             |
| **URL**               | `https://api.blooio.com/send-message`              |
| **Response Format**   | `JSON`                                             |
| **Body Content Type** | `JSON (application/json)`                          |

---

### 3. Add Required Headers

Add three headers exactly as shown:

```text
Accept:        application/json
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE
Content-Type:  application/json

options.systemMessage:
Your only purpose is to brief the user on what is happening around them. Be concise. Use emojis and tell them what's happening around them. Give them a full report like
What is happening, where, the time, units and the status of the units
